Reviews.Title: “Metropol Has All You Need”
Reviews.Author: Steven S
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed in Hotel Metropol with a couple of friends. We loved the location close to the zocalo, fine arts museum, etc. We were interested in going to Lagunilla open air antique market, so that was a fair walk, but otherwise it was centrally located to most of the places we wanted to see on our short visit. The staff was friendly and helpful, so that made it easier for us to get wherever we wanted to go. The value was there, and there were no untoward surprises. Highly recommended! No complaints at all.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: backpacker2110
Reviews.Content: I thought this hotel was great. Good location near the zocalo (main plaza), metro stations, restaurants and some famous sights in Mexico City. Staff were friendly. In room safe needs refundable deposit to use. Always had hot water. Restaurant in hotel was good. Rooms were clean and spacious for this type of hotel. A good stay. Sometimes can be noisy with all the traffic on the streets, but that's Mexico City!

Reviews.Title: “Good service, good value, good location”
Reviews.Author: Ewa_Z
Reviews.Content: Positives: - good location - close to Bellas Artes, some 10 minutes from zocalo - typical western European standard of an average business hotel - no thrills, but no shame either - clean, spacey etc. - very good deal for the rooms booked over the internet, especially considering we are in the capital city. No downsides - I would come back.

Reviews.Title: “average”
Reviews.Author: Ying W
Reviews.Content: good price for good location... the enviroment is fine... but the service is terrbile-they cannot solve any problem for you...the elevator is very narrow

Reviews.Title: “great location, great price”
Reviews.Author: mss059
Reviews.Content: This place is only a few blocks from the Alemeda, and an easy walk to anything in the Historic Centre. The place is clean, if a little noisy (but that's Mexico City), and the staff are friendly and available all night for late arrivals. The staff's lack of English is not a problem, it's my lack of Spanish that causes the confusion, but everything that needed to be dealt with was, save for a small plumbing problem that I hope they dealt with when the room was vacated. The place also has a nice little lounge, a rather expensive and not so great restaurant (but there are lots of other options around) and a tourist service with a very helpful English speaking gentleman in the office. Once he knows you, he is very eager to help with details...he even chased us down the block to clarify things one morning. Don't bother with the guys flogging tours on the street....

Reviews.Title: “Good service and location”
Reviews.Author: Dean W
Reviews.Content: We had a bad start to our trip to Mexico City as our transfer did not turn up to pick us up. Also when we arrived at the hotel Metrepol we did not have a booking, this was the fault of our travel agent. But even though we had no reservation the staff at the hotel gave us a room while they tried to figure out why our agent hadn't sent them an accommodation voucher. Eventually our room was sorted out by the staff at the Metropol, which is not something you'd get at every hotel. Only a couple of staff at the hotel speaks fluent English but this did not cause us any problems. The hotel was basic and slightly dated but clean and comfortable. The room had a TV with a few English channels, a safe ($10 USD deposit required), dressing area, bath and shower. The hotels restaurant was very nice and the prices were low. Although around the corner from the hotel there were quite a few restaurants and a 7/11. The hotel is around 10 minutes walk from Monumento a la RevoluciÃ³n. Located in the lobby of the hotel is a travel office where trips to local attractions can be purchased, we paid $70 USD for two people to go and see the teotihuacan ruins, along with a few stops on the way. I recommend this hotel due to the help we received with our problems and the location.

Reviews.Title: “AWFUL!!! RUN and don't look back”
Reviews.Author: lafenix
Reviews.Content: The good reviews must be from employees. The employees are rude beyond belief, they ignore you, look at you like you are dirt. I speak fluent Sapnish and ti was a good thing. They speak no english but that is okay. It is Mexico. Our room was a triple. They advertise refrigerators, microwave, jacuzzi, etc., in all rooms. There is none of this. Our keyed door broke and we had to wait for the concierge to let us in our room when they felt like it. Said we could not change rooms. We changed hotels. I have been here in DF manyu times and this is the only hotel I found rude employees. They are not just rude they are freaks!! Wireless internet gets turned off at 10 PM just because they want too. They turn it back on if you yell but only after 8 in the morning when the chief grosero goes home. Kind of a bad neighborhood butt it is 2 blocks from Alameda. Go to Fontan, San Diego, or any other for a little less money.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and nice people”
Reviews.Author: LyricJen
Reviews.Content: We stayed about 4 nights as this was where our tour was departing. Staff at the hotel were very nice, even the cleaning lady was courteous. I think the location is central and quite close to the Zocalo (where Cathedral is), pharmacy, taquerias, restaurants, and even the subways. I didn't really feel dangerous in Mexico City. We walked around even late at night. I think we paid $55 which I thought was bargain. Definitely recommend as it is a great deal!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value and Location”
Reviews.Author: SanFranVoyageur
Reviews.Content: During the swine flu outbreak, we stayed here for $38, which is a relative bargain for this area. Rooms are nicely decorated with fans, cable TV, phones, modern bathrooms, windows that open and floor fans. There is a full service restaurant with room service and on site parking. There are 2 PCs with internet access in the lobby area, but they were agonizingly slow and unreliable. The is wireless in the rooms. Reading lights were dim. We have stayed at many hotels in D.F. over the years, and this is one of the best values. Staff were courteous and there is a travel agency in the lobby for tours.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Metropol was certainly adequate!”
Reviews.Author: jtelfer
Reviews.Content: Hotel Metropol is not for honeymooners. The walls are paper thin but the accommodations are just fine. It is certainly a good bang for the buck. The hotel lobby is lovely, offering a lot of local marble and artwork. There are two elevators that service the 160 rooms, but they are TINY. Three of us with a suitcase each was too much! The rooms provided us with a king size bed, a beautifully large bathroom (GREAT WATER PRESSURE) and good lighting. There was NO airconditioning, and that was a little disturbing considering it was in the high 80's during the day and the high 70's at night. The restaurant was good, but not great. The food was simple, but they tried to make it elegant. The prices weren't bad, but the quality wasn't great. The breakfast buffet was a nice treat, (included with our room fee). The coffee was some of the best I've ever had in my life, and as a traveler through much of South and Central America, I know my coffee!!!! The staff was incredible. Very nice, they spoke a good broken english, and were always willing to smile and giggle! The hotel isn't on a great street, but one block up, one block down, you're in the heart of it all.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service, Central Location”
Reviews.Author: aristak
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Metropol for four days in April. The service and staff were absolutely excellent providing good advice on resturants, tour companies and more. They changed our room from interior to exterior (the front street was quiet) quite happily when we changed our mind. The hotel is located just two blocks from the very lovely and green Allemeda park and a 15 minute walk from the Zocalo. The hotel does not have air conditioning, so I could not say if it would be uncomfortable in the summer. A high quality tourist hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Great travel office in hotel, GOOD prices”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Metropol in Mexico City. DF on the address is District Federal which you may see on many Mexico City addresses. The Hotel is verfy central and within walking distance of the main Zocoro (city center). The subway in Mexico City is only 20 cents ! which is 2 pesos, so don't be afraid to use it. Information in the subway has colorful maps. Wonderful Museums in the city especially at Chapultapec Park. Don't miss the Restaurant Havanna. Good food and great coffee. The Hotel Metropol has a full buffet breakfast, which is about $6 but worth it. Safe in the room, but you have to pay a deposit at the desk to get the key lock, and the money is returned at checkout.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Metropol was great!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Metropol was a great place to stay. Next time I am in Mexico city I plan to stay there again. Good for business travelers and people who are vaguely familiar with Mexico city. NOT good for students traveling alone as it is not near many eateries, stores etc. - is two subway (Metro) stops from the Zona Rosa, but is within 2 blocks walking distance to a subway station. Hovever, the service is great and the restaurant serves good food. The bar is ok - only one bartender - not many varieties, and imported liquor is very expensive as with all places in Mexico. Only a 5 block walk to the Palacio de Bellas Artes and a $20ish taxi ride from the bus station. I'd say it deserves 3 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Metropol 2nd Home”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A very good average hotel. Our group had a nice block of rooms. The restaurant service was excellent. I only wished the rooms would have been airconditioned.
